trans-unit.source: SELECT ts_rewrite('a & b'::tsquery, 'SELECT t,s FROM aliases') → 'b' & ( 'foo' | 'bar' )
stddev ( numeric_type ) → double precision for real or double precision, otherwise numeric
stddev_pop ( numeric_type ) → double precision for real or double precision, otherwise numeric
ts_headline('The fat cat ate the rat.', 'cat') → The fat <b>cat</b> ate the rat.
tsrange — Range of timestamp without time zone
trans-unit.target: tsrange — timestamp without time zone 的时间戳范围

trans-unit.source: tstzrange — Range of timestamp with time zone
trans-unit.target: tstzrange — timestamp with time zone 的时间戳范围

trans-unit.source: UNION effectively appends the result of query2 to the result of query1 (although there is no guarantee that this is the order in which the rows are actually returned). Furthermore, it eliminates duplicate rows from its result, in the same way as DISTINCT, unless UNION ALL is used.
trans-unit.target: UNION 有效地将 query2 的结果附加到 query1 的结果上（尽管不能保证这是实际返回行的顺序）。此外，除非使用 UNION ALL ，否则它会以与 DISTINCT 相同的方式从结果中消除重复的行。

trans-unit.source: var_pop ( numeric_type ) → double precision for real or double precision, otherwise numeric
variance ( numeric_type ) → double precision for real or double precision, otherwise numeric
"quoted text": text inside quote marks will be converted to terms separated by <-> operators, as if processed by phraseto_tsquery.
trans-unit.target: "quoted text" ：引号内的文本将转换为由 <-> 运算符分隔的术语，就好像由 phraseto_tsquery 处理一样。

trans-unit.source: <> is the standard SQL notation for “not equal”. != is an alias, which is converted to <> at a very early stage of parsing. Hence, it is not possible to implement != and <> operators that do different things.
'fsm' returns the size of the Free Space Map (see Section 68.3) associated with the relation.
trans-unit.target: 'fsm' 返回与该关系关联的可用空间图的大小（请参见68.3节）。

trans-unit.source: 'init' returns the size of the initialization fork, if any, associated with the relation.
trans-unit.target: 'init' 返回与该关系相关联的初始化分支的大小（如果有）。

trans-unit.source: 'main' returns the size of the main data fork of the relation.
trans-unit.target: 'main' 返回关系的主数据分支的大小。

trans-unit.source: 'vm' returns the size of the Visibility Map (see Section 68.4) associated with the relation.
trans-unit.target: 'vm' 返回与该关系关联的可视化贴图的大小（请参见第68.4节）。

trans-unit.source: * denotes repetition of the previous item zero or more times.
trans-unit.target: * 表示上一个项目重复零次或多次。

trans-unit.source: + denotes repetition of the previous item one or more times.
trans-unit.target: + 表示上一个项目重复一次或多次。

trans-unit.source: -- and /* cannot appear anywhere in an operator name, since they will be taken as the start of a comment.
trans-unit.target: -- 和 /* 不能出现在运算符名称的任何位置，因为它们将被用作注释的开头。

trans-unit.source: --create-slot and --start can be specified together. --drop-slot cannot be combined with another action.
trans-unit.target: --create-slot 可以一起指定--create-slot和 --start 。 --drop-slot 不能与其他操作组合使用。

trans-unit.source: -: a dash will be converted to the ! operator.
-: the logical not operator, converted to the the ! operator.
trans-unit.target: - ：逻辑非运算符，转换为 ! 操作员。

trans-unit.source: -f{ s | i | o | b | t | n | m | h }
trans-unit.target: -f { s | i | o | b | t | n | m | h }

trans-unit.source: .datetime() item method is not implemented yet mainly because immutable jsonpath functions and operators cannot reference session timezone, which is used in some datetime operations. Datetime support will be added to jsonpath in future versions of PostgreSQL.
trans-unit.target: .datetime() 项目方法尚未实现，主要是因为不可变的 jsonpath 函数和运算符无法引用会话时区，该会话时区在某些datetime操作中使用。Datetime支持将在PostgreSQL的未来版本中添加到 jsonpath 中。

trans-unit.source: /stuff/index.html, in the context of a URL

0 specifies a digit position that will always be printed, even if it contains a leading/trailing zero. 9 also specifies a digit position, but if it is a leading zero then it will be replaced by a space, while if it is a trailing zero and fill mode is specified then it will be deleted. (For to_number(), these two pattern characters are equivalent.)
trans-unit.target: 0 指定始终会被打印的数字位置，即使它包含前导/后缀零。 9 还指定了一个数字位置，但是如果它是前导零，则将其替换为空格，而如果它是尾随零并且指定了填充模式，则将其删除。（对于 to_number() ，这两个模式字符是等效的。）

trans-unit.source: 6490428 / 2048 gives approximately 3169.154, so in this example we need at least 3170 huge pages, which we can set with:
trans-unit.target: 6490428 / 2048 个提供大约 3169.154 ，所以在这个例子中，我们至少需要 3170 个巨大的页面，我们可以设置：

trans-unit.source: ? denotes repetition of the previous item zero or one time.
trans-unit.target: ? 表示重复上一个项目零或一次。

trans-unit.source: ABORT rolls back the current transaction and causes all the updates made by the transaction to be discarded. This command is identical in behavior to the standard SQL command ROLLBACK, and is present only for historical reasons.
trans-unit.target: ABORT 将回滚当前事务，并使该事务进行的所有更新都被丢弃。该命令的行为与标准SQL命令ROLLBACK相同，并且仅出于历史原因存在。

trans-unit.source: ABSOLUTE fetches are not any faster than navigating to the desired row with a relative move: the underlying implementation must traverse all the intermediate rows anyway. Negative absolute fetches are even worse: the query must be read to the end to find the last row, and then traversed backward from there. However, rewinding to the start of the query (as with FETCH ABSOLUTE 0) is fast.
trans-unit.target: ABSOLUTE 获取并不比通过相对移动导航到所需行更快：基础实现无论如何都必须遍历所有中间行。负绝对取值甚至更糟：必须将查询读到末尾才能找到最后一行，然后从那里向后遍历。但是，快 FETCH ABSOLUTE 0 查询的开头（与FETCH ABSOLUTE 0一样）很快。

trans-unit.source: ADD GENERATED { ALWAYS | BY DEFAULT } AS IDENTITYSET GENERATED { ALWAYS | BY DEFAULT }DROP IDENTITY [ IF EXISTS ]
trans-unit.target: ADD GENERATED { ALWAYS | BY DEFAULT } AS IDENTITY SET GENERATED { ALWAYS | BY DEFAULT } DROP IDENTITY [ IF EXISTS ]

trans-unit.source: ALSO indicates that the commands should be executed in addition to the original command.
trans-unit.target: ALSO 指示除了原始命令外，还应该执行命令。

trans-unit.source: ALTER AGGREGATE changes the definition of an aggregate function.
trans-unit.target: ALTER AGGREGATE 更改聚合函数的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER COLLATION changes the definition of a collation.
trans-unit.target: ALTER COLLATION 更改排序规则的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER CONVERSION changes the definition of a conversion.
ALTER DATABASE changes the attributes of a database.
trans-unit.target: ALTER DATABASE 更改数据库的属性。

trans-unit.source: ALTER DEFAULT PRIVILEGES allows you to set the privileges that will be applied to objects created in the future. (It does not affect privileges assigned to already-existing objects.) Currently, only the privileges for schemas, tables (including views and foreign tables), sequences, functions, and types (including domains) can be altered. For this command, functions include aggregates and procedures. The words FUNCTIONS and ROUTINES are equivalent in this command. (ROUTINES is preferred going forward as the standard term for functions and procedures taken together. In earlier PostgreSQL releases, only the word FUNCTIONS was allowed. It is not possible to set default privileges for functions and procedures separately.)
trans-unit.target: ALTER DEFAULT PRIVILEGES 允许您设置将应用于将来创建的对象的特权。 （这不会影响分配给已经存在的对象的特权。）当前，只能更改模式，表（包括视图和外部表），序列，函数和类型（包括域）的特权。对于此命令，功能包括集合和过程。在此命令中，单词 FUNCTIONS 和 ROUTINES 是等效的。 （ ROUTINES 一直是函数和过程结合使用的标准术语，因此是首选。在早期的PostgreSQL发行版中，仅允许使用 FUNCTIONS 一词。无法分别为函数和过程设置默认特权。）

trans-unit.source: ALTER DOMAIN changes the definition of an existing domain. There are several sub-forms:
trans-unit.target: ALTER DOMAIN 更改现有域的定义。有几种子形式：

trans-unit.source: ALTER DOMAIN conforms to the SQL standard, except for the OWNER, RENAME, SET SCHEMA, and VALIDATE CONSTRAINT variants, which are PostgreSQL extensions. The NOT VALID clause of the ADD CONSTRAINT variant is also a PostgreSQL extension.
trans-unit.target: ALTER DOMAIN 符合SQL标准，但 OWNER ， RENAME ， SET SCHEMA 和 VALIDATE CONSTRAINT 变体除外，它们是PostgreSQL的扩展。 ADD CONSTRAINT 变体的 NOT VALID 子句也是PostgreSQL扩展。

trans-unit.source: ALTER EVENT TRIGGER changes properties of an existing event trigger.
trans-unit.target: ALTER EVENT TRIGGER 更改现有事件触发器的属性。

trans-unit.source: ALTER EXTENSION changes the definition of an installed extension. There are several subforms:
trans-unit.target: ALTER EXTENSION 更改已安装扩展的定义。有几个子窗体：

trans-unit.source: ALTER FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER changes the definition of a foreign-data wrapper. The first form of the command changes the support functions or the generic options of the foreign-data wrapper (at least one clause is required). The second form changes the owner of the foreign-data wrapper.
trans-unit.target: ALTER FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 更改外来数据包装器的定义。该命令的第一种形式更改了外部数据包装程序的支持功能或通用选项（至少需要一个子句）。第二种形式更改了外部数据包装器的所有者。

trans-unit.source: ALTER FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED), except that the HANDLER, VALIDATOR, OWNER TO, and RENAME clauses are extensions.
trans-unit.target: ALTER FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED），但 HANDLER ， VALIDATOR ， OWNER TO 和 RENAME 子句是扩展名。

trans-unit.source: ALTER FOREIGN TABLE DROP COLUMN can be used to drop the only column of a foreign table, leaving a zero-column table. This is an extension of SQL, which disallows zero-column foreign tables.
trans-unit.target: ALTER FOREIGN TABLE DROP COLUMN 可用于删除外部表的唯一列，而保留零列表。这是SQL的扩展，不允许使用零列外部表。

trans-unit.source: ALTER FOREIGN TABLE changes the definition of an existing foreign table. There are several subforms:
trans-unit.target: ALTER FOREIGN TABLE 更改现有外部表的定义。有几个子窗体：

trans-unit.source: ALTER FUNCTION changes the definition of a function.

ALTER GROUP changes the attributes of a user group. This is an obsolete command, though still accepted for backwards compatibility, because groups (and users too) have been superseded by the more general concept of roles.
trans-unit.target: ALTER GROUP 更改用户组的属性。这是一个过时的命令，尽管仍然向后兼容，因为组（和用户）也已被更一般的角色概念所取代。

trans-unit.source: ALTER INDEX changes the definition of an existing index. There are several subforms described below. Note that the lock level required may differ for each subform. An ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock is held unless explicitly noted. When multiple subcommands are listed, the lock held will be the strictest one required from any subcommand.
trans-unit.target: ALTER INDEX 更改现有索引的定义。下面介绍了几个子窗体。请注意，每个子窗体所需的锁定级别可能有所不同。一个 ACCESS EXCLUSIVE 锁举行，除非明确指出。当列出多个子命令时，所持有的锁定将是任何子命令所要求的最严格的一种。

trans-unit.source: ALTER LANGUAGE changes the definition of a procedural language. The only functionality is to rename the language or assign a new owner. You must be superuser or owner of the language to use ALTER LANGUAGE.
trans-unit.target: ALTER LANGUAGE 更改过程语言的定义。唯一的功能是重命名语言或分配新所有者。您必须是该语言的超级用户或所有者，才能使用 ALTER LANGUAGE 。

trans-unit.source: ALTER LARGE OBJECT changes the definition of a large object.
trans-unit.target: ALTER LARGE OBJECT 更改大对象的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW changes various auxiliary properties of an existing materialized view.
trans-unit.target: ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW 更改现有物化视图的各种辅助属性。

trans-unit.source: ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW is a PostgreSQL extension.
ALTER OPERATOR CLASS changes the definition of an operator class.
trans-unit.target: ALTER OPERATOR CLASS 更改操作员类的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER OPERATOR FAMILY changes the definition of an operator family. You can add operators and support functions to the family, remove them from the family, or change the family's name or owner.
trans-unit.target: ALTER OPERATOR FAMILY 更改操作员系列的定义。您可以向家族添加操作员和支持功能，将其从家族中删除，或更改家族的名称或所有者。

trans-unit.source: ALTER OPERATOR FAMILY does not presently check whether the operator family definition includes all the operators and functions required by the index method, nor whether the operators and functions form a self-consistent set. It is the user's responsibility to define a valid operator family.
trans-unit.target: ALTER OPERATOR FAMILY 当前不检查运算符家族定义是否包括索引方法所需的所有运算符和函数，也不检查运算符和函数是否形成一个自洽集合。定义有效的操作员系列是用户的责任。

trans-unit.source: ALTER OPERATOR changes the definition of an operator.
trans-unit.target: ALTER OPERATOR 更改运算符的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER POLICY changes the definition of an existing row-level security policy. Note that ALTER POLICY only allows the set of roles to which the policy applies and the USING and WITH CHECK expressions to be modified. To change other properties of a policy, such as the command to which it applies or whether it is permissive or restrictive, the policy must be dropped and recreated.
trans-unit.target: ALTER POLICY 更改现有行级安全策略的定义。请注意， ALTER POLICY 仅允许应用策略的角色集以及 USING 和 WITH CHECK 表达式被修改。要更改策略的其他属性，例如对其应用的命令或它是允许的还是限制性的，必须删除并重新创建该策略。

trans-unit.source: ALTER PROCEDURE changes the definition of a procedure.
ALTER ROLE cannot change a role's memberships. Use GRANT and REVOKE to do that.
trans-unit.target: ALTER ROLE 无法更改角色的成员资格。使用GRANT和REVOKE可以做到这一点。

trans-unit.source: ALTER ROLE changes the attributes of a PostgreSQL role.

ALTER ROUTINE changes the definition of a routine, which can be an aggregate function, a normal function, or a procedure. See under ALTER AGGREGATE, ALTER FUNCTION, and ALTER PROCEDURE for the description of the parameters, more examples, and further details.
trans-unit.target: ALTER ROUTINE 更改例程的定义，该例程可以是聚合函数，普通函数或过程。有关参数的说明，更多示例和更多详细信息，请参见ALTER AGGREGATE，ALTER FUNCTION和ALTER PROCEDURE下的内容。

trans-unit.source: ALTER RULE changes properties of an existing rule. Currently, the only available action is to change the rule's name.
trans-unit.target: ALTER RULE 更改现有规则的属性。当前，唯一可用的操作是更改规则的名称。

trans-unit.source: ALTER RULE is a PostgreSQL language extension, as is the entire query rewrite system.
trans-unit.target: ALTER RULE 和整个查询重写系统一样，是PostgreSQL语言的扩展。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SCHEMA changes the definition of a schema.

trans-unit.target: ALTER SEQUENCE 阻止并发的 nextval ， currval ， lastval 和 setval 调用。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SEQUENCE changes the parameters of an existing sequence generator. Any parameters not specifically set in the ALTER SEQUENCE command retain their prior settings.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SEQUENCE 更改现有序列生成器的参数。任何未在 ALTER SEQUENCE 命令中专门设置的参数均保留其先前的设置。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SEQUENCE conforms to the SQL standard, except for the AS, START WITH, OWNED BY, OWNER TO, RENAME TO, and SET SCHEMA clauses, which are PostgreSQL extensions.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SEQUENCE 符合SQL标准，但 AS ， START WITH ， OWNED BY ， OWNER TO ， RENAME TO 和 SET SCHEMA 子句是PostgreSQL的扩展。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SEQUENCE does not affect the currval status for the sequence. (Before PostgreSQL 8.3, it sometimes did.)
trans-unit.target: ALTER SEQUENCE 不会影响序列的 currval 状态。（在PostgreSQL 8.3之前，有时会这样做。）

trans-unit.source: ALTER SEQUENCE will not immediately affect nextval results in backends, other than the current one, that have preallocated (cached) sequence values. They will use up all cached values prior to noticing the changed sequence generation parameters. The current backend will be affected immediately.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SEQUENCE 不会立即影响后端（当前后端除外）中具有预分配（缓存）序列值的 nextval 结果。在注意到更改的序列生成参数之前，它们将用尽所有缓存的值。当前后端将立即受到影响。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SERVER changes the definition of a foreign server. The first form changes the server version string or the generic options of the server (at least one clause is required). The second form changes the owner of the server.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SERVER 更改外部服务器的定义。第一种形式更改服务器版本字符串或服务器的通用选项（至少需要一个子句）。第二种形式更改服务器的所有者。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SERVER conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED). The OWNER TO and RENAME forms are PostgreSQL extensions.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SERVER 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED）。该 OWNER TO 和 RENAME 形式是PostgreSQL扩展。

trans-unit.source: ALTER STATISTICS changes the parameters of an existing extended statistics object. Any parameters not specifically set in the ALTER STATISTICS command retain their prior settings.
trans-unit.target: ALTER STATISTICS 更改现有扩展统计对象的参数。任何未在 ALTER STATISTICS 命令中专门设置的参数均保留其先前的设置。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SUBSCRIPTION can change most of the subscription properties that can be specified in CREATE SUBSCRIPTION.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SUBSCRIPTION 可以更改可以在CREATE SUBSCRIPTION中指定的大多数订阅属性。

trans-unit.source: ALTER SYSTEM is used for changing server configuration parameters across the entire database cluster. It can be more convenient than the traditional method of manually editing the postgresql.conf file. ALTER SYSTEM writes the given parameter setting to the postgresql.auto.conf file, which is read in addition to postgresql.conf. Setting a parameter to DEFAULT, or using the RESET variant, removes that configuration entry from the postgresql.auto.conf file. Use RESET ALL to remove all such configuration entries.
trans-unit.target: ALTER SYSTEM 用于更改整个数据库集群中的服务器配置参数。它比手动编辑 postgresql.conf 文件的传统方法更方便。 ALTER SYSTEM 将给定的参数设置写入 postgresql.auto.conf 文件，该文件是 postgresql.conf 的补充。将参数设置为 DEFAULT 或使用 RESET 变体，将从 postgresql.auto.conf 文件中删除该配置条目。使用 RESET ALL 删除所有此类配置条目。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TABLE DROP COLUMN can be used to drop the only column of a table, leaving a zero-column table. This is an extension of SQL, which disallows zero-column tables.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TABLE DROP COLUMN 可用于删除表的唯一列，而保留零列表。这是SQL的扩展，不允许使用零列表。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TABLE changes the definition of an existing table. There are several subforms described below. Note that the lock level required may differ for each subform. An ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock is acquired unless explicitly noted. When multiple subcommands are given, the lock acquired will be the strictest one required by any subcommand.

ALTER TABLE changes the definition of an existing table. There are several subforms described below. Note that the lock level required may differ for each subform. An ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock is held unless explicitly noted. When multiple subcommands are listed, the lock held will be the strictest one required from any subcommand.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TABLE 更改现有表的定义。下面介绍了几个子窗体。请注意，每个子窗体所需的锁定级别可能有所不同。一个 ACCESS EXCLUSIVE 锁举行，除非明确指出。当列出多个子命令时，所持有的锁定将是任何子命令所要求的最严格的一种。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TABLESPACE can be used to change the definition of a tablespace.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TABLESPACE 可以用于更改表空间的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION changes the definition of a text search configuration. You can modify its mappings from token types to dictionaries, or change the configuration's name or owner.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION 更改文本搜索配置的定义。您可以修改其从令牌类型到字典的映射，或者更改配置的名称或所有者。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY changes the definition of a text search dictionary. You can change the dictionary's template-specific options, or change the dictionary's name or owner.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY 更改文本搜索词典的定义。您可以更改词典的特定于模板的选项，或更改词典的名称或所有者。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TEXT SEARCH PARSER changes the definition of a text search parser. Currently, the only supported functionality is to change the parser's name.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TEXT SEARCH PARSER 更改文本搜索解析器的定义。当前，唯一受支持的功能是更改解析器的名称。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE changes the definition of a text search template. Currently, the only supported functionality is to change the template's name.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE 更改文本搜索模板的定义。当前，唯一受支持的功能是更改模板的名称。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TRIGGER changes properties of an existing trigger. The RENAME clause changes the name of the given trigger without otherwise changing the trigger definition. The DEPENDS ON EXTENSION clause marks the trigger as dependent on an extension, such that if the extension is dropped, the trigger will automatically be dropped as well.
trans-unit.target: ALTER TRIGGER 更改现有触发器的属性。该 RENAME 条款的改变给定的触发器的名称，而不用改变触发器的定义。的 DEPENDS ON EXTENSION 子句标记触发那样依赖的延伸，使得如果扩展名将被删除，触发器将自动被丢弃，以及。

trans-unit.source: ALTER TRIGGER is a PostgreSQL extension of the SQL standard.
ALTER TYPE changes the definition of an existing type. There are several subforms:
trans-unit.target: ALTER TYPE 更改现有类型的定义。有几个子窗体：

trans-unit.source: ALTER USER MAPPING changes the definition of a user mapping.
trans-unit.target: ALTER USER MAPPING 更改用户映射的定义。

trans-unit.source: ALTER USER MAPPING conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED). There is a subtle syntax issue: The standard omits the FOR key word. Since both CREATE USER MAPPING and DROP USER MAPPING use FOR in analogous positions, and IBM DB2 (being the other major SQL/MED implementation) also requires it for ALTER USER MAPPING, PostgreSQL diverges from the standard here in the interest of consistency and interoperability.
trans-unit.target: ALTER USER MAPPING 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED）。存在一个细微的语法问题：标准省略了 FOR 关键字。由于 CREATE USER MAPPING 和 DROP USER MAPPING 都在相似的位置使用 FOR ，并且IBM DB2（作为另一个主要的SQL / MED实现）也需要 ALTER USER MAPPING ，因此PostgreSQL在此出于一致性和互操作性而与标准有所不同。

trans-unit.source: ALTER USER is now an alias for ALTER ROLE.
trans-unit.target: ALTER USER 现在是ALTER ROLE的别名。

trans-unit.source: ALTER VIEW changes various auxiliary properties of a view. (If you want to modify the view's defining query, use CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW.)
trans-unit.target: ALTER VIEW 更改视图的各种辅助属性。（如果要修改视图的定义查询，请使用 CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW 。）

trans-unit.source: ALTER VIEW is a PostgreSQL extension of the SQL standard.
ANALYZE can be set to the name of a type-specific statistics collection function, or NONE to remove the type's statistics collection function. Using this option requires superuser privilege.

ANALYZE collects statistics about the contents of tables in the database, and stores the results in the pg_statistic system catalog. Subsequently, the query planner uses these statistics to help determine the most efficient execution plans for queries.
trans-unit.target: ANALYZE 收集有关数据库中表内容的统计信息，并将结果存储在 pg_statistic 系统目录中。随后，查询计划者使用这些统计信息来帮助确定最有效的查询执行计划。

trans-unit.source: ANALYZE computes extended statistics based on the same sample of table rows that it takes for computing regular single-column statistics. Since the sample size is increased by increasing the statistics target for the table or any of its columns (as described in the previous section), a larger statistics target will normally result in more accurate extended statistics, as well as more time spent calculating them.
trans-unit.target: ANALYZE 基于用于计算常规单列统计信息的相同表行样本来计算扩展统计信息。由于通过增加表或其任何列的统计目标（如上一节中所述）来增加样本量，因此较大的统计目标通常会导致更准确的扩展统计，以及更多的计算时间。

trans-unit.source: ANALYZE requires only a read lock on the target table, so it can run in parallel with other activity on the table.
trans-unit.target: ANALYZE 只需要对目标表进行读锁定，因此它可以与表上的其他活动并行运行。

trans-unit.source: Activity: The server process is idle. This is used by system processes waiting for activity in their main processing loop. wait_event will identify the specific wait point.
trans-unit.target: Activity ：服务器进程处于空闲状态。系统进程在其主处理循环中等待活动时使用它。 wait_event 将标识特定的等待点。

trans-unit.source: BEFORE ROW triggers cannot change which partition is the final destination for a new row.
BEFORE ROW triggers, if necessary, must be defined on individual partitions, not the partitioned table.
trans-unit.target: BEFORE ROW 必要时，必须在单个分区（而不是分区表）上定义ROW之前的触发器。
BEGIN READ WRITE START TRANSACTION READ WRITE 读写，开始事务读写

trans-unit.source: BEGIN initiates a transaction block, that is, all statements after a BEGIN command will be executed in a single transaction until an explicit COMMIT or ROLLBACK is given. By default (without BEGIN), PostgreSQL executes transactions in “autocommit” mode, that is, each statement is executed in its own transaction and a commit is implicitly performed at the end of the statement (if execution was successful, otherwise a rollback is done).
trans-unit.target: BEGIN 启动事务块，即 BEGIN 命令之后的所有语句将在单个事务中执行，直到给出明确的COMMIT或ROLLBACK。默认情况下（没有 BEGIN ），PostgreSQL在“自动提交”模式下执行事务，也就是说，每个语句都在自己的事务中执行，并且在语句末尾隐式执行一次提交（如果执行成功，则回滚完成） ）。

trans-unit.source: BEGIN is a PostgreSQL language extension. It is equivalent to the SQL-standard command START TRANSACTION, whose reference page contains additional compatibility information.
trans-unit.target: BEGIN 是PostgreSQL语言扩展。它等效于SQL标准命令START TRANSACTION，其参考页包含其他兼容性信息。

trans-unit.source: BETWEEN SYMMETRIC is like BETWEEN except there is no requirement that the argument to the left of AND be less than or equal to the argument on the right. If it is not, those two arguments are automatically swapped, so that a nonempty range is always implied.
trans-unit.target: BETWEEN SYMMETRIC 与 BETWEEN 相似，只是不要求 AND 左侧的参数小于或等于右侧的参数。如果不是，则会自动交换这两个参数，以便始终隐含一个非空范围。

trans-unit.source: BrinOpcInfo.oi_opaque can be used by the operator class routines to pass information between support functions during an index scan.
trans-unit.target: BrinOpcInfo 。操作员类例程可以使用 oi_opaque 在索引扫描期间在支持功能之间传递信息。

trans-unit.source: BufferPin: The server process is waiting to access to a data buffer during a period when no other process can be examining that buffer. Buffer pin waits can be protracted if another process holds an open cursor which last read data from the buffer in question.
trans-unit.target: BufferPin ：在没有其他进程可以检查数据缓冲区的时间段内，服务器进程正在等待访问数据缓冲区。如果另一个进程持有一个打开的游标，该游标最后一次从有关缓冲区中读取数据，则可能会延长缓冲区的等待时间。

trans-unit.source: Bytea octets are output in hex format by default. If you change bytea_output to escape, “non-printable” octets are converted to their equivalent three-digit octal value and preceded by one backslash. Most “printable” octets are output by their standard representation in the client character set, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: Bytea 八位位组输出 hex 的默认格式。如果将bytea_output更改为 escape ，则“不可打印的”八位位组将转换为它们等效的三位数八进制值，并以一个反斜杠开头。大多数“可打印”八位位组都是通过它们在客户端字符集中的标准表示输出的，例如：

trans-unit.source: CALLED ON NULL INPUT (the default) indicates that the function will be called normally when some of its arguments are null. It is then the function author's responsibility to check for null values if necessary and respond appropriately.
trans-unit.target: CALLED ON NULL INPUT （默认值）表示该函数的某些参数为null时将正常调用该函数。然后，函数作者有责任检查空值（如有必要）并做出适当响应。

trans-unit.source: CALLED ON NULL INPUT changes the function so that it will be invoked when some or all of its arguments are null. RETURNS NULL ON NULL INPUT or STRICT changes the function so that it is not invoked if any of its arguments are null; instead, a null result is assumed automatically. See CREATE FUNCTION for more information.
trans-unit.target: CALLED ON NULL INPUT 更改函数，以便在其某些或所有参数为null时将调用该函数。 RETURNS NULL ON NULL INPUT 或 STRICT 上返回NULL会更改函数，以便在其任何参数为null时不调用该函数；而是自动假定为空结果。有关更多信息，请参见CREATE FUNCTION。

trans-unit.source: CALLED ON NULL INPUTRETURNS NULL ON NULL INPUTSTRICT
trans-unit.target: CALLED ON NULL INPUT RETURNS NULL ON NULL INPUT STRICT NULL

trans-unit.source: CASE clauses can be used wherever an expression is valid. Each condition is an expression that returns a boolean result. If the condition's result is true, the value of the CASE expression is the result that follows the condition, and the remainder of the CASE expression is not processed. If the condition's result is not true, any subsequent WHEN clauses are examined in the same manner. If no WHENcondition yields true, the value of the CASE expression is the result of the ELSE clause. If the ELSE clause is omitted and no condition is true, the result is null.
trans-unit.target: CASE 只要表达式有效，就可以使用CASE子句。每个 condition 都是一个返回 boolean 结果的表达式。如果条件的结果为true，则 CASE 表达式的值是紧随该条件的 result ，并且不处理 CASE 表达式的其余部分。如果条件的结果不正确，则以相同方式检查所有后续 WHEN 子句。如果没有 WHEN condition 产生true，所述的值 CASE 表达式是 result 的的 ELSE 子句。如果是 ELSE 子句被省略，没有条件为真，结果为null。

trans-unit.source: CASE is not a cure-all for such issues, however. One limitation of the technique illustrated above is that it does not prevent early evaluation of constant subexpressions. As described in Section 37.7, functions and operators marked IMMUTABLE can be evaluated when the query is planned rather than when it is executed. Thus for example
trans-unit.target: CASE 不能解决所有问题。上面说明的技术的一个局限性在于它不能阻止对常量子表达式的早期评估。如第37.7节所述，标记为 IMMUTABLE 的函数和运算符可以在计划查询时而不是在执行查询时进行评估。因此，例如

trans-unit.source: CASE is not a cure-all for such issues, however. One limitation of the technique illustrated above is that it does not prevent early evaluation of constant subexpressions. As described in Section 37.7, functions and operators marked IMMUTABLE can be evaluated when the query is planned rather than when it is executed. Thus for example

CHECK clauses specify integrity constraints or tests which values of the domain must satisfy. Each constraint must be an expression producing a Boolean result. It should use the key word VALUE to refer to the value being tested. Expressions evaluating to TRUE or UNKNOWN succeed. If the expression produces a FALSE result, an error is reported and the value is not allowed to be converted to the domain type.
trans-unit.target: CHECK 子句指定完整性约束或测试域必须满足的值。每个约束必须是一个产生布尔结果的表达式。它应该使用关键字 VALUE 来引用要测试的值。评估为TRUE或UNKNOWN的表达式成功。如果表达式产生的结果为FALSE，则会报告错误，并且不允许将该值转换为域类型。

trans-unit.source: CHECK constraints are merged in essentially the same way as columns: if multiple parent tables and/or the new table definition contain identically-named CHECK constraints, these constraints must all have the same check expression, or an error will be reported. Constraints having the same name and expression will be merged into one copy. A constraint marked NO INHERIT in a parent will not be considered. Notice that an unnamed CHECK constraint in the new table will never be merged, since a unique name will always be chosen for it.
trans-unit.target: CHECK 约束基本上以与列相同的方式合并：如果多个父表和/或新表定义包含名称相同的 CHECK 约束，则这些约束必须全部具有相同的检查表达式，否则将报告错误。具有相同名称和表达式的约束将合并为一个副本。将不会考虑在父级中标记为 NO INHERIT 的约束。请注意，新表中未命名的 CHECK 约束将永远不会被合并，因为将始终为其选择唯一的名称。

trans-unit.source: CHECK constraints will be copied. No distinction is made between column constraints and table constraints. Not-null constraints are always copied to the new table.
trans-unit.target: CHECK 约束将被复制。列约束和表约束之间没有区别。非空约束始终会复制到新表中。

trans-unit.source: CLOSE frees the resources associated with an open cursor. After the cursor is closed, no subsequent operations are allowed on it. A cursor should be closed when it is no longer needed.
trans-unit.target: CLOSE 释放与打开的游标关联的资源。关闭游标后，不允许对其进行后续操作。不再需要游标时，应将其关闭。

trans-unit.source: CLOSE is fully conforming with the SQL standard. CLOSE ALL is a PostgreSQL extension.
trans-unit.target: CLOSE 完全符合SQL标准。 CLOSE ALL 是PostgreSQL扩展。

trans-unit.source: CLUSTER can re-sort the table using either an index scan on the specified index, or (if the index is a b-tree) a sequential scan followed by sorting. It will attempt to choose the method that will be faster, based on planner cost parameters and available statistical information.
trans-unit.target: CLUSTER 可以使用对指定索引的索引扫描或（如果索引是b树）（如果索引是b树）对表进行重新排序，然后进行排序。它将尝试根据计划者成本参数和可用的统计信息来选择更快的方法。

trans-unit.source: CLUSTER instructs PostgreSQL to cluster the table specified by table_name based on the index specified by index_name. The index must already have been defined on table_name.
trans-unit.target: CLUSTER 指示PostgreSQL 根据 index_name 指定的索引对 table_name 指定的表进行集群。该索引必须已经在 table_name 上定义。

trans-unit.source: CLUSTER is currently scanning the table using an index scan.
trans-unit.target: CLUSTER 当前正在使用索引扫描来扫描表。
CLUSTER 当前正在对元组进行排序。

trans-unit.source: CLUSTER is currently writing the new heap.

CLUSTER without any parameter reclusters all the previously-clustered tables in the current database that the calling user owns, or all such tables if called by a superuser. This form of CLUSTER cannot be executed inside a transaction block.
trans-unit.target: CLUSTER 不带任何参数reclusters所有当前数据库先前聚集的表主叫用户拥有，或称为由超级用户所有这样的表。这种形式的 CLUSTER 不能在事务块内执行。

trans-unit.source: COMMENT stores a comment about a database object.
trans-unit.target: COMMENT 存储有关数据库对象的注释。

trans-unit.source: COMMIT PREPARED commits a transaction that is in prepared state.
trans-unit.target: COMMIT PREPARED 提交处于准备状态的事务。

trans-unit.source: COMMIT PREPARED is a PostgreSQL extension. It is intended for use by external transaction management systems, some of which are covered by standards (such as X/Open XA), but the SQL side of those systems is not standardized.
trans-unit.target: COMMIT PREPARED 是PostgreSQL扩展。它旨在供外部事务管理系统使用，其中一些已包含在标准中（例如X / Open XA），但这些系统的SQL端未标准化。

trans-unit.source: COMMIT commits the current transaction. All changes made by the transaction become visible to others and are guaranteed to be durable if a crash occurs.
trans-unit.target: COMMIT 提交当前事务。事务所做的所有更改对其他人都可见，并且如果发生崩溃，则保证是持久的。

trans-unit.source: CONCURRENTLY and WITH NO DATA may not be specified together.
trans-unit.target: CONCURRENTLY 和 WITH NO DATA 可以不被同时指定。

trans-unit.source: COPY ... FROM commands are published as INSERT operations.
trans-unit.target: COPY ... FROM 命令作为 INSERT 操作发布。

trans-unit.source: COPY FROM can be used with plain, foreign, or partitioned tables or with views that have INSTEAD OF INSERT triggers.
trans-unit.target: COPY FROM 可以与普通表，外部表或分区表一起使用，也可以与具有 INSTEAD OF INSERT 触发器的视图一起使用。

trans-unit.source: COPY FROM will invoke any triggers and check constraints on the destination table. However, it will not invoke rules.
trans-unit.target: COPY FROM 将调用任何触发器并检查目标表上的约束。但是，它不会调用规则。

trans-unit.source: COPY FROM, when the target table has been created or truncated earlier in the same transaction
trans-unit.target: COPY FROM ，在同一事务中较早创建或截断了目标表时

trans-unit.source: COPY TO can only be used with plain tables, not with views. However, you can write COPY (SELECT * FROM viewname) TO ... to copy the current contents of a view.
trans-unit.target: COPY TO 只能用于普通表，不能用于视图。但是，您可以写 COPY (SELECT * FROM viewname) TO ... 复制视图的当前内容。

trans-unit.source: COPY TO will terminate each row with a Unix-style newline (“ ”). Servers running on Microsoft Windows instead output carriage return/newline (“ ”), but only for COPY to a server file; for consistency across platforms, COPY TO STDOUT always sends “ ” regardless of server platform. COPY FROM can handle lines ending with newlines, carriage returns, or carriage return/newlines. To reduce the risk of error due to un-backslashed newlines or carriage returns that were meant as data, COPY FROM will complain if the line endings in the input are not all alike.
trans-unit.target: COPY TO 将以Unix风格的换行符（“ ”）终止每一行。在Microsoft Windows上运行的服务器将输出回车/换行符（“ ”），但仅用于将 COPY 复制到服务器文件；为了实现跨平台的一致性，无论服务器平台如何， COPY TO STDOUT 始终发送“ ”。 COPY FROM 可以处理以换行符，回车符或回车符/换行符结尾的行。为了减少由于未加反斜杠的换行符或将回车符作为数据而导致的错误风险，如果输入中的行尾不尽相同，则 COPY FROM 将发出投诉。

trans-unit.source: COPY input and output is affected by DateStyle. To ensure portability to other PostgreSQL installations that might use non-default DateStyle settings, DateStyle should be set to ISO before using COPY TO. It is also a good idea to avoid dumping data with IntervalStyle set to sql_standard, because negative interval values might be misinterpreted by a server that has a different setting for IntervalStyle.
trans-unit.target: COPY 输入和输出受 DateStyle 影响。为了确保可移植到可能使用非默认 DateStyle 设置的其他PostgreSQL安装，应在使用 COPY TO 之前将 DateStyle 设置为 ISO 。最好避免在 IntervalStyle 设置为 sql_standard 的情况下转储数据，因为对于 IntervalStyle 设置不同的服务器可能会误解负间隔值。

trans-unit.source: COPY into tables that were created or truncated in the same transaction
trans-unit.target: COPY 到在同一事务中创建或截断的表中

trans-unit.source: COPY is fastest when used within the same transaction as an earlier CREATE TABLE or TRUNCATE command. In such cases no WAL needs to be written, because in case of an error, the files containing the newly loaded data will be removed anyway. However, this consideration only applies when wal_level is minimal as all commands must write WAL otherwise.

COPY is fastest when used within the same transaction as an earlier CREATE TABLE or TRUNCATE command. In such cases no WAL needs to be written, because in case of an error, the files containing the newly loaded data will be removed anyway. However, this consideration only applies when wal_level is minimal for non-partitioned tables as all commands must write WAL otherwise.
trans-unit.target: COPY 与早期的 CREATE TABLE 或 TRUNCATE 命令在同一事务中使用时，COPY最快。在这种情况下，无需写入WAL，因为如果发生错误，则无论如何都将删除包含新加载的数据的文件。然而，当这样的考虑仅适用wal_level是 minimal 非分区表的所有命令都必须以其他方式写WAL。

trans-unit.source: COPY moves data between PostgreSQL tables and standard file-system files. COPY TO copies the contents of a table to a file, while COPY FROM copies data from a file to a table (appending the data to whatever is in the table already). COPY TO can also copy the results of a SELECT query.
trans-unit.target: COPY 在PostgreSQL表和标准文件系统文件之间移动数据。 COPY TO 把一个表中的内容到一个文件，而 COPY FROM 将数据从一个文件到一个表（追加数据，无论是在已经表）。 COPY TO 也可以复制 SELECT 查询的结果。

trans-unit.source: COPY only deals with the specific table named; it does not copy data to or from child tables. Thus for example COPY table TO shows the same data as SELECT * FROM ONLY table. But COPY (SELECT * FROM table) TO ... can be used to dump all of the data in an inheritance hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: COPY 仅处理名为的特定表。它不会在子表之间复制数据。因此，例如 COPY table TO 显示的数据与 SELECT * FROM ONLY table 。但是 COPY (SELECT * FROM table) TO ... 可用于转储继承层次结构中的所有数据。

trans-unit.source: COPY stops operation at the first error. This should not lead to problems in the event of a COPY TO, but the target table will already have received earlier rows in a COPY FROM. These rows will not be visible or accessible, but they still occupy disk space. This might amount to a considerable amount of wasted disk space if the failure happened well into a large copy operation. You might wish to invoke VACUUM to recover the wasted space.
trans-unit.target: COPY stops operation at the first error. This should not lead to problems in the event of a COPY TO , but the target table will already have received earlier rows in a COPY FROM . These rows will not be visible or accessible, but they still occupy disk space. This might amount to a considerable amount of wasted disk space if the failure happened well into a large copy operation. You might wish to invoke VACUUM to recover the wasted space.

trans-unit.source: COPY with a file name instructs the PostgreSQL server to directly read from or write to a file. The file must be accessible by the PostgreSQL user (the user ID the server runs as) and the name must be specified from the viewpoint of the server. When PROGRAM is specified, the server executes the given command and reads from the standard output of the program, or writes to the standard input of the program. The command must be specified from the viewpoint of the server, and be executable by the PostgreSQL user. When STDIN or STDOUT is specified, data is transmitted via the connection between the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: COPY 带有文件名的COPY指示PostgreSQL服务器直接从文件读取或写入文件。该文件必须可由PostgreSQL用户访问（服务器运行时使用的用户ID），并且必须从服务器的角度指定名称。当指定了 PROGRAM 时，服务器将执行给定的命令并从程序的标准输出中读取，或写入程序的标准输入中。该命令必须从服务器的角度指定，并且可由PostgreSQL用户执行。当指定 STDIN 或 STDOUT 时，数据将通过客户端和服务器之间的连接进行传输。

trans-unit.source: COPY's FORCE_QUOTE option is currently not supported by file_fdw.
trans-unit.target: COPY 的 FORCE_QUOTE 选项目前不支持 file_fdw 。

trans-unit.source: CREATE ACCESS METHOD creates a new access method.
trans-unit.target: CREATE ACCESS METHOD 创建一个新的访问方法。

trans-unit.source: CREATE ACCESS METHOD is a PostgreSQL extension.

CREATE AGGREGATE defines a new aggregate function. CREATE OR REPLACE AGGREGATE will either define a new aggregate function or replace an existing definition. Some basic and commonly-used aggregate functions are included with the distribution; they are documented in Section 9.20. If one defines new types or needs an aggregate function not already provided, then CREATE AGGREGATE can be used to provide the desired features.
trans-unit.target: CREATE AGGREGATE 定义一个新的聚合函数。 CREATE OR REPLACE AGGREGATE 将定义新的聚合函数或替换现有的定义。发行版中包含一些基本的和常用的聚合函数；它们记录在第9.20节中。如果定义新类型或需要尚未提供的聚合函数，则可以使用 CREATE AGGREGATE 提供所需的功能。

trans-unit.source: CREATE AGGREGATE defines a new aggregate function. CREATE OR REPLACE AGGREGATE will either define a new aggregate function or replace an existing definition. Some basic and commonly-used aggregate functions are included with the distribution; they are documented in Section 9.21. If one defines new types or needs an aggregate function not already provided, then CREATE AGGREGATE can be used to provide the desired features.
CREATE AGGREGATE is a PostgreSQL language extension. The SQL standard does not provide for user-defined aggregate functions.
trans-unit.target: CREATE AGGREGATE 是PostgreSQL语言扩展。SQL标准不提供用户定义的聚合函数。

trans-unit.source: CREATE CAST defines a new cast. A cast specifies how to perform a conversion between two data types. For example,
trans-unit.target: CREATE CAST 定义一个新的演员表。强制转换指定如何在两种数据类型之间执行转换。例如，

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION "de-u-co-phonebk-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'de-u-co-phonebk');CREATE COLLATION "de-u-co-phonebk-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'de@collation=phonebook');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION "de-u-co-phonebk-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'de-u-co-phonebk'); CREATE COLLATION "de-u-co-phonebk-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'de@collation=phonebook');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION "und-u-co-emoji-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'und-u-co-emoji');CREATE COLLATION "und-u-co-emoji-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = '@collation=emoji');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION "und-u-co-emoji-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = 'und-u-co-emoji'); CREATE COLLATION "und-u-co-emoji-x-icu" (provider = icu, locale = '@collation=emoji');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION digitslast (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kr-latn-digit');CREATE COLLATION digitslast (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colReorder=latn-digit');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION digitslast (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kr-latn-digit'); CREATE COLLATION digitslast (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colReorder=latn-digit');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION latinlast (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kr-grek-latn');CREATE COLLATION latinlast (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colReorder=grek-latn');
CREATE COLLATION numeric (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kn-true');CREATE COLLATION numeric (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colNumeric=yes');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION numeric (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kn-true'); CREATE COLLATION numeric (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colNumeric=yes');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kf-upper-kr-grek-latn');CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colCaseFirst=upper;colReorder=grek-latn');
CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kf-upper-kr-latn-digit');CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colCaseFirst=upper;colReorder=latn-digit');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kf-upper-kr-latn-digit'); CREATE COLLATION special (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colCaseFirst=upper;colReorder=latn-digit');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION upperfirst (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kf-upper');CREATE COLLATION upperfirst (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colCaseFirst=upper');
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION upperfirst (provider = icu, locale = 'en-u-kf-upper'); CREATE COLLATION upperfirst (provider = icu, locale = 'en@colCaseFirst=upper');

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION defines a new collation using the specified operating system locale settings, or by copying an existing collation.
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION 使用指定的操作系统区域设置或通过复制现有的排序规则来定义新的排序规则。

trans-unit.source: CREATE COLLATION takes a SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE lock, which is self-conflicting, on the pg_collation system catalog, so only one CREATE COLLATION command can run at a time.
trans-unit.target: CREATE COLLATION 在 pg_collation 系统目录上采用了一个 SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE 锁，这是自冲突的，因此一次只能运行一个 CREATE COLLATION 命令。

trans-unit.source: CREATE CONSTRAINT TRIGGER is a PostgreSQL extension of the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: CREATE CONSTRAINT TRIGGER 是SQL标准的PostgreSQL扩展。

trans-unit.source: CREATE CONVERSION defines a new conversion between character set encodings. Also, conversions that are marked DEFAULT can be used for automatic encoding conversion between client and server. For this purpose, two conversions, from encoding A to B and from encoding B to A, must be defined.
trans-unit.target: CREATE CONVERSION 定义了字符集编码之间的新转换。另外，标记为 DEFAULT 的转换可用于客户端和服务器之间的自动编码转换。为此，必须定义两次转换，从编码A到B 和从编码B到A。

trans-unit.source: CREATE CONVERSION defines a new conversion between two character set encodings.
CREATE CONVERSION is a PostgreSQL extension. There is no CREATE CONVERSION statement in the SQL standard, but a CREATE TRANSLATION statement that is very similar in purpose and syntax.
trans-unit.target: CREATE CONVERSION 是PostgreSQL的扩展。SQL标准中没有 CREATE CONVERSION 语句，但是目的和语法非常相似的 CREATE TRANSLATION 语句。

trans-unit.source: CREATE DATABASE actually works by copying an existing database. By default, it copies the standard system database named template1. Thus that database is the “template” from which new databases are made. If you add objects to template1, these objects will be copied into subsequently created user databases. This behavior allows site-local modifications to the standard set of objects in databases. For example, if you install the procedural language PL/Perl in template1, it will automatically be available in user databases without any extra action being taken when those databases are created.
trans-unit.target: CREATE DATABASE 实际上是通过复制现有数据库来工作的。默认情况下，它将复制名为 template1 的标准系统数据库。因此，该数据库是创建新数据库的“模板”。如果将对象添加到 template1 ，则这些对象将被复制到随后创建的用户数据库中。此行为允许对数据库中标准对象集进行站点本地修改。例如，如果将过程语言PL / Perl安装在 template1 中，则它将自动在用户数据库中可用，而在创建这些数据库时无需采取任何其他操作。

trans-unit.source: CREATE DATABASE cannot be executed inside a transaction block.
trans-unit.target: CREATE DATABASE 不能在事务块内执行。

trans-unit.source: CREATE DATABASE creates a new PostgreSQL database.
trans-unit.target: CREATE DATABASE 创建一个新的PostgreSQL数据库。

trans-unit.source: CREATE DOMAIN creates a new domain. A domain is essentially a data type with optional constraints (restrictions on the allowed set of values). The user who defines a domain becomes its owner.
trans-unit.target: CREATE DOMAIN 创建一个新域。域本质上是具有可选约束（对允许的值集的约束）的数据类型。定义域的用户将成为其所有者。

trans-unit.source: CREATE EVENT TRIGGER creates a new event trigger. Whenever the designated event occurs and the WHEN condition associated with the trigger, if any, is satisfied, the trigger function will be executed. For a general introduction to event triggers, see Chapter 39. The user who creates an event trigger becomes its owner.
trans-unit.target: CREATE EVENT TRIGGER 创建一个新的事件触发器。每当发生指定事件并且满足与触发器关联的 WHEN 条件（如果有）时，将执行触发器功能。有关事件触发器的一般介绍，请参见第39章。创建事件触发器的用户将成为其所有者。

trans-unit.source: CREATE EVENT TRIGGER creates a new event trigger. Whenever the designated event occurs and the WHEN condition associated with the trigger, if any, is satisfied, the trigger function will be executed. For a general introduction to event triggers, see Chapter 39. The user who creates an event trigger becomes its owner.
CREATE EXTENSION loads a new extension into the current database. There must not be an extension of the same name already loaded.
trans-unit.target: CREATE EXTENSION 将新的扩展名加载到当前数据库中。不得已加载具有相同名称的扩展名。

trans-unit.source: CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED), with the exception that the HANDLER and VALIDATOR clauses are extensions and the standard clauses LIBRARY and LANGUAGE are not implemented in PostgreSQL.
trans-unit.target: CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED），但 HANDLER 和 VALIDATOR 子句是扩展名，而标准子句 LIBRARY 和 LANGUAGE 在PostgreSQL中未实现。

trans-unit.source: CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER creates a new foreign-data wrapper. The user who defines a foreign-data wrapper becomes its owner.
trans-unit.target: CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 创建一个新的外部数据包装器。定义外部数据包装器的用户将成为其所有者。

trans-unit.source: CREATE FOREIGN TABLE also automatically creates a data type that represents the composite type corresponding to one row of the foreign table. Therefore, foreign tables cannot have the same name as any existing data type in the same schema.
trans-unit.target: CREATE FOREIGN TABLE 还会自动创建一个数据类型，该数据类型表示与外部表的一行相对应的复合类型。因此，外部表不能与同一模式中的任何现有数据类型具有相同的名称。

trans-unit.source: CREATE FOREIGN TABLE creates a new foreign table in the current database. The table will be owned by the user issuing the command.
trans-unit.target: CREATE FOREIGN TABLE 在当前数据库中创建一个新的外部表。该表将由发出命令的用户拥有。

trans-unit.source: CREATE FUNCTION defines a new function. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION will either create a new function, or replace an existing definition. To be able to define a function, the user must have the USAGE privilege on the language.
trans-unit.target: CREATE FUNCTION 定义一个新函数。 CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION 将创建一个新功能，或替换一个现有的定义。为了能够定义功能，用户必须对语言具有 USAGE 特权。

trans-unit.source: CREATE GROUP is now an alias for CREATE ROLE.
trans-unit.target: CREATE GROUP 现在是CREATE ROLE的别名。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY is scanning the index searching for tuples that need to be validated. This phase is skipped when not in concurrent mode. Columns blocks_total (set to the total size of the index) and blocks_done contain the progress information for this phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在扫描索引以搜索需要验证的元组。不处于并发模式时，将跳过此阶段。列 blocks_total （设置为索引的总大小）和 blocks_done 列包含此阶段的进度信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY is scanning the table to validate the index tuples collected in the previous two phases. This phase is skipped when not in concurrent mode. Columns blocks_total (set to the total size of the table) and blocks_done contain the progress information for this phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在扫描表以验证在前两个阶段中收集的索引元组。不处于并发模式时，将跳过此阶段。列 blocks_total （设置为表的总大小）和 blocks_done 列包含此阶段的进度信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY is sorting the output of the index scanning phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在对索引扫描阶段的输出进行排序。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY or REINDEX CONCURRENTLY is waiting for transactions that can potentially see the table to release their snapshots. This phase is skipped when not in concurrent mode. Columns lockers_total, lockers_done and current_locker_pid contain the progress information for this phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 或 REINDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在等待可能看到该表释放其快照的事务。不处于并发模式时，将跳过此阶段。列 lockers_total ， lockers_done 和 current_locker_pid 包含此阶段的进度信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY or REINDEX CONCURRENTLY is waiting for transactions with write locks that can potentially see the table to finish. This phase is skipped when not in concurrent mode. Columns lockers_total, lockers_done and current_locker_pid contain the progress information for this phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 或 REINDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在等待具有写锁的事务，这些写锁可能会看到表完成。不处于并发模式时，将跳过此阶段。列 lockers_total ， lockers_done 和 current_locker_pid 包含此阶段的进度信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY or REINDEX CONCURRENTLY is waiting for transactions with write locks that can potentially write into the table to finish. This phase is skipped when not in concurrent mode. Columns lockers_total, lockers_done and current_locker_pid contain the progress information for this phase.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY 或 REINDEX CONCURRENTLY 正在等待具有写锁的事务，这些写锁可能会写入表中以完成操作。不处于并发模式时，将跳过此阶段。列 lockers_total ， lockers_done 和 current_locker_pid 包含此阶段的进度信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX (and variants such as ALTER TABLE ADD PRIMARY KEY)
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX （以及诸如 ALTER TABLE ADD PRIMARY KEY 之类的变体）

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX and REINDEX apply deduplication to create posting list tuples, though the strategy they use is slightly different. Each group of duplicate ordinary tuples encountered in the sorted input taken from the table is merged into a posting list tuple before being added to the current pending leaf page. Individual posting list tuples are packed with as many TIDs as possible. Leaf pages are written out in the usual way, without any separate deduplication pass. This strategy is well-suited to CREATE INDEX and REINDEX because they are once-off batch operations.

CREATE INDEX constructs an index on the specified column(s) of the specified relation, which can be a table or a materialized view. Indexes are primarily used to enhance database performance (though inappropriate use can result in slower performance).
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX 在指定关系的指定列上构造索引，该索引可以是表或实例化视图。索引主要用于增强数据库性能（尽管使用不当会导致性能降低）。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX is a PostgreSQL language extension. There are no provisions for indexes in the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX 是PostgreSQL语言扩展。SQL标准中没有索引的规定。

trans-unit.source: CREATE INDEX or REINDEX is preparing to create the index. This phase is expected to be very brief.
trans-unit.target: CREATE INDEX 或 REINDEX 正在准备创建索引。预计此阶段将非常简短。

trans-unit.source: CREATE LANGUAGE effectively associates the language name with handler function(s) that are responsible for executing functions written in the language. Refer to Chapter 55 for more information about language handlers.
trans-unit.target: CREATE LANGUAGE 有效地将语言名称与处理程序函数相关联，这些处理函数负责执行以该语言编写的函数。有关语言处理程序的更多信息，请参见第55章。

trans-unit.source: CREATE LANGUAGE effectively associates the language name with handler function(s) that are responsible for executing functions written in the language. Refer to Chapter 55 for more information about language handlers.
CREATE LANGUAGE registers a new procedural language with a PostgreSQL database. Subsequently, functions and procedures can be defined in this new language.
trans-unit.target: CREATE LANGUAGE 在PostgreSQL数据库中注册了一种新的过程语言。随后，可以用这种新语言定义功能和过程。

trans-unit.source: CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW defines a materialized view of a query. The query is executed and used to populate the view at the time the command is issued (unless WITH NO DATA is used) and may be refreshed later using REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW.
trans-unit.target: CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW 定义查询的实例化视图。该查询将在发出命令时执行并用于填充视图（除非 WITH NO DATA ），以后可以使用 REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW 进行刷新。

trans-unit.source: CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW is a PostgreSQL extension.

CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW is similar to CREATE TABLE AS, except that it also remembers the query used to initialize the view, so that it can be refreshed later upon demand. A materialized view has many of the same properties as a table, but there is no support for temporary materialized views.
trans-unit.target: CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW 与 CREATE TABLE AS 类似，不同之处在于它还记住用于初始化视图的查询，以便以后可以按需刷新。实例化视图具有许多与表相同的属性，但不支持临时实例化视图。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS creates a new operator class. An operator class defines how a particular data type can be used with an index. The operator class specifies that certain operators will fill particular roles or “strategies” for this data type and this index method. The operator class also specifies the support functions to be used by the index method when the operator class is selected for an index column. All the operators and functions used by an operator class must be defined before the operator class can be created.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS 创建一个新的运算符类。运算符类定义如何将特定数据类型与索引一起使用。操作员类别指定某些操作员将为此数据类型和此索引方法扮演特定的角色或“策略”。当为索引列选择操作符类时，操作符类还指定索引方法要使用的支持功能。必须先定义操作符类使用的所有操作符和函数，然后才能创建该操作符类。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS does not presently check whether the operator class definition includes all the operators and functions required by the index method, nor whether the operators and functions form a self-consistent set. It is the user's responsibility to define a valid operator class.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS 当前不检查操作符类定义是否包括索引方法所需的所有操作符和函数，也不检查操作符和函数是否形成自洽集合。定义有效的操作员类别是用户的责任。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS is a PostgreSQL extension. There is no CREATE OPERATOR CLASS statement in the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR CLASS 是PostgreSQL扩展。SQL标准中没有 CREATE OPERATOR CLASS 语句。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY creates a new operator family. An operator family defines a collection of related operator classes, and perhaps some additional operators and support functions that are compatible with these operator classes but not essential for the functioning of any individual index. (Operators and functions that are essential to indexes should be grouped within the relevant operator class, rather than being “loose” in the operator family. Typically, single-data-type operators are bound to operator classes, while cross-data-type operators can be loose in an operator family containing operator classes for both data types.)
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY 员族会创建一个新的操作员族。运算符家族定义了一组相关的运算符类，以及可能与这些运算符类兼容但对于任何单个索引的功能而言并非必需的一些其他运算符和支持功能。（对于索引必不可少的运算符和函数应该在相关的运算符类中分组，而不是在运算符家族中“松散”。通常，单数据类型的运算符绑定到运算符类，而跨数据类型的运算符在包含两种数据类型的运算符类别的运算符系列中可能会比较松散。）

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY is a PostgreSQL extension. There is no CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY statement in the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY 是PostgreSQL扩展。SQL标准中没有 CREATE OPERATOR FAMILY 语句。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR defines a new operator, name. The user who defines an operator becomes its owner. If a schema name is given then the operator is created in the specified schema. Otherwise it is created in the current schema.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR 定义一个新的运算符 name 。定义操作员的用户将成为其所有者。如果指定了架构名称，则会在指定的架构中创建运算符。否则，它将在当前架构中创建。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OPERATOR is a PostgreSQL extension. There are no provisions for user-defined operators in the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OPERATOR 是PostgreSQL扩展。SQL标准中没有针对用户定义的运算符的规定。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OR REPLACE LANGUAGE will either create a new language, or replace an existing definition. If the language already exists, its parameters are updated according to the command, but the language's ownership and permissions settings do not change, and any existing functions written in the language are assumed to still be valid.

CREATE OR REPLACE LANGUAGE will either create a new language, or replace an existing definition. If the language already exists, its parameters are updated according to the values specified or taken from pg_pltemplate, but the language's ownership and permissions settings do not change, and any existing functions written in the language are assumed to still be valid. In addition to the normal privilege requirements for creating a language, the user must be superuser or owner of the existing language. The REPLACE case is mainly meant to be used to ensure that the language exists. If the language has a pg_pltemplate entry then REPLACE will not actually change anything about an existing definition, except in the unusual case where the pg_pltemplate entry has been modified since the language was created.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OR REPLACE LANGUAGE 将创建新的语言或替换现有的定义。如果该语言已经存在，则其参数将根据 pg_pltemplate 中指定的值或从pg_pltemplate中获取的值进行更新，但是该语言的所有权和权限设置不会更改，并且假定使用该语言编写的任何现有功能仍然有效。除了创建语言的常规特权要求之外，用户还必须是现有语言的超级用户或所有者。在 REPLACE 的情况下，主要意在用于确保语言存在。如果该语言具有 pg_pltemplate 条目，则 REPLACE 实际上不会更改现有定义的任何内容，除非在异常情况下（自创建该语言以来已修改 pg_pltemplate 条目）。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW is a PostgreSQL language extension. So is the concept of a temporary view. The WITH ( ... ) clause is an extension as well.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW 是PostgreSQL语言的扩展。临时视图的概念也是如此。该 WITH ( ... ) 子句是一个扩展为好。

trans-unit.source: CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW is similar, but if a view of the same name already exists, it is replaced. The new query must generate the same columns that were generated by the existing view query (that is, the same column names in the same order and with the same data types), but it may add additional columns to the end of the list. The calculations giving rise to the output columns may be completely different.
trans-unit.target: CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW 类似，但是如果已经存在相同名称的视图，则将其替换。新查询必须生成与现有视图查询生成的列相同的列（即，相同的列名以相同的顺序和相同的数据类型），但是它可能会在列表的末尾添加其他列。产生输出列的计算可能完全不同。

trans-unit.source: CREATE PROCEDURE defines a new procedure. CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE will either create a new procedure, or replace an existing definition. To be able to define a procedure, the user must have the USAGE privilege on the language.
trans-unit.target: CREATE PROCEDURE 定义一个新过程。 CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE 将创建一个新过程，或替换一个现有的定义。为了能够定义过程，用户必须对语言具有 USAGE 特权。

trans-unit.source: CREATE PUBLICATION adds a new publication into the current database. The publication name must be distinct from the name of any existing publication in the current database.
trans-unit.target: CREATE PUBLICATION 将新出版物添加到当前数据库中。发布名称必须不同于当前数据库中任何现有发布的名称。

trans-unit.source: CREATE ROLE adds a new role to a PostgreSQL database cluster. A role is an entity that can own database objects and have database privileges; a role can be considered a “user”, a “group”, or both depending on how it is used. Refer to Chapter 21 and Chapter 20 for information about managing users and authentication. You must have CREATEROLE privilege or be a database superuser to use this command.
trans-unit.target: CREATE ROLE 为PostgreSQL数据库集群添加了新角色。角色是可以拥有数据库对象并具有数据库特权的实体。根据角色的使用方式，可以将角色视为“用户”，“组”或两者。参见第21章和第20章有关管理用户和认证信息。您必须具有 CREATEROLE 特权或是数据库超级用户才能使用此命令。

trans-unit.source: CREATE ROLE adds a new role to a PostgreSQL database cluster. A role is an entity that can own database objects and have database privileges; a role can be considered a “user”, a “group”, or both depending on how it is used. Refer to Chapter 21 and Chapter 20 for information about managing users and authentication. You must have CREATEROLE privilege or be a database superuser to use this command.
CREATE RULE defines a new rule applying to a specified table or view. CREATE OR REPLACE RULE will either create a new rule, or replace an existing rule of the same name for the same table.
trans-unit.target: CREATE RULE 定义了应用于指定表或视图的新规则。 CREATE OR REPLACE RULE 将创建一个新规则，或为同一表替换一个具有相同名称的现有规则。

trans-unit.source: CREATE RULE is a PostgreSQL language extension, as is the entire query rewrite system.
trans-unit.target: CREATE RULE 和整个查询重写系统一样，是PostgreSQL语言的扩展。

trans-unit.source: CREATE SCHEMA enters a new schema into the current database. The schema name must be distinct from the name of any existing schema in the current database.
trans-unit.target: CREATE SCHEMA 将新架构输入当前数据库。模式名称必须不同于当前数据库中任何现有模式的名称。

trans-unit.source: CREATE SEQUENCE conforms to the SQL standard, with the following exceptions:
trans-unit.target: CREATE SEQUENCE 符合SQL标准，但以下情况除外：

trans-unit.source: CREATE SEQUENCE creates a new sequence number generator. This involves creating and initializing a new special single-row table with the name name. The generator will be owned by the user issuing the command.
trans-unit.target: CREATE SEQUENCE 创建一个新的序列号生成器。这涉及使用名称 name 创建和初始化新的特殊单行表。生成器将由发出命令的用户所有。

trans-unit.source: CREATE SERVER defines a new foreign server. The user who defines the server becomes its owner.
trans-unit.target: CREATE SERVER 定义一个新的外部服务器。定义服务器的用户将成为其所有者。

trans-unit.source: CREATE STATISTICS will create a new extended statistics object tracking data about the specified table, foreign table or materialized view. The statistics object will be created in the current database and will be owned by the user issuing the command.
trans-unit.target: CREATE STATISTICS 将创建一个新的扩展统计对象，以跟踪有关指定表，外部表或实例化视图的数据。统计信息对象将在当前数据库中创建，并由发出命令的用户拥有。

trans-unit.source: CREATE SUBSCRIPTION adds a new subscription for the current database. The subscription name must be distinct from the name of any existing subscription in the database.
trans-unit.target: CREATE SUBSCRIPTION 为当前数据库添加一个新的订阅。订阅名称必须不同于数据库中任何现有订阅的名称。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE AS bears some resemblance to creating a view, but it is really quite different: it creates a new table and evaluates the query just once to fill the new table initially. The new table will not track subsequent changes to the source tables of the query. In contrast, a view re-evaluates its defining SELECT statement whenever it is queried.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLE AS 与创建视图有些相似，但实际上是完全不同的：它创建一个新表并仅对查询进行一次评估以最初填充新表。新表将不会跟踪对查询源表的后续更改。相反，无论何时查询，视图都会重新评估其定义的 SELECT 语句。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE AS conforms to the SQL standard. The following are nonstandard extensions:
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLE AS 符合SQL标准。以下是非标准扩展：

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE AS creates a table and fills it with data computed by a SELECT command. The table columns have the names and data types associated with the output columns of the SELECT (except that you can override the column names by giving an explicit list of new column names).
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLE AS 创建一个表，并用 SELECT 命令计算的数据填充该表。表列具有与 SELECT 的输出列关联的名称和数据类型（但可以通过提供新列名的显式列表来覆盖列名）。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE also automatically creates a data type that represents the composite type corresponding to one row of the table. Therefore, tables cannot have the same name as any existing data type in the same schema.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLE 还会自动创建一个数据类型，该数据类型表示与表的一行相对应的复合类型。因此，表不能与同一模式中的任何现有数据类型具有相同的名称。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE will create a new, initially empty table in the current database. The table will be owned by the user issuing the command.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLE 将在当前数据库中创建一个新的，最初为空的表。该表将由发出命令的用户拥有。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLESPACE cannot be executed inside a transaction block.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLESPACE 不能在事务块内执行。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLESPACE registers a new cluster-wide tablespace. The tablespace name must be distinct from the name of any existing tablespace in the database cluster.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TABLESPACE 注册一个新的群集范围的表空间。表空间名称必须与数据库集群中任何现有表空间的名称不同。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION creates a new text search configuration. A text search configuration specifies a text search parser that can divide a string into tokens, plus dictionaries that can be used to determine which tokens are of interest for searching.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION 创建一个新的文本搜索配置。文本搜索配置指定了一个文本搜索解析器，该解析器可以将字符串划分为标记，再加上可以用来确定哪些标记值得搜索的字典。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY creates a new text search dictionary. A text search dictionary specifies a way of recognizing interesting or uninteresting words for searching. A dictionary depends on a text search template, which specifies the functions that actually perform the work. Typically the dictionary provides some options that control the detailed behavior of the template's functions.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY 创建一个新的文本搜索字典。文本搜索词典指定了一种识别有趣或不有趣的单词进行搜索的方法。词典取决于文本搜索模板，该模板指定了实际执行工作的功能。通常，字典提供一些选项来控制模板功能的详细行为。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TEXT SEARCH PARSER creates a new text search parser. A text search parser defines a method for splitting a text string into tokens and assigning types (categories) to the tokens. A parser is not particularly useful by itself, but must be bound into a text search configuration along with some text search dictionaries to be used for searching.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TEXT SEARCH PARSER 创建一个新的文本搜索解析器。文本搜索解析器定义了一种方法，用于将文本字符串拆分为标记并为标记分配类型（类别）。解析器本身并不是特别有用，但是必须与一些用于搜索的文本搜索字典一起绑定到文本搜索配置中。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE creates a new text search template. Text search templates define the functions that implement text search dictionaries. A template is not useful by itself, but must be instantiated as a dictionary to be used. The dictionary typically specifies parameters to be given to the template functions.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE 创建一个新的文本搜索模板。文本搜索模板定义了实现文本搜索词典的功能。模板本身不是有用的，但必须实例化为要使用的字典。字典通常指定要提供给模板功能的参数。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TRANSFORM defines a new transform. CREATE OR REPLACE TRANSFORM will either create a new transform, or replace an existing definition.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TRANSFORM 定义一个新的变换。 CREATE OR REPLACE TRANSFORM 将创建新的转换，或替换现有的定义。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TRIGGER creates a new trigger. The trigger will be associated with the specified table, view, or foreign table and will execute the specified function function_name when certain operations are performed on that table.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TRIGGER 创建一个新的触发器。触发器将与指定的表，视图或外部表关联，并且在对该表执行某些操作时将执行指定的函数 function_name 。

trans-unit.source: CREATE TYPE registers a new data type for use in the current database. The user who defines a type becomes its owner.
trans-unit.target: CREATE TYPE 注册一个新的数据类型以供当前数据库使用。定义类型的用户将成为其所有者。
CREATE USER MAPPING 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED）。

trans-unit.source: CREATE USER MAPPING defines a mapping of a user to a foreign server. A user mapping typically encapsulates connection information that a foreign-data wrapper uses together with the information encapsulated by a foreign server to access an external data resource.
trans-unit.target: CREATE USER MAPPING 定义用户到外部服务器的映射。用户映射通常封装外来数据包装程序使用的连接信息以及外来服务器封装的访问外部数据资源的信息。

trans-unit.source: CREATE USER is now an alias for CREATE ROLE. The only difference is that when the command is spelled CREATE USER, LOGIN is assumed by default, whereas NOLOGIN is assumed when the command is spelled CREATE ROLE.
trans-unit.target: CREATE USER 现在是CREATE ROLE的别名。唯一的区别是，当命令拼写为 CREATE USER 时，默认情况下假定为 LOGIN ，而当命令拼写为 CREATE ROLE 时则假定为 NOLOGIN 。

trans-unit.source: CREATE VIEW defines a view of a query. The view is not physically materialized. Instead, the query is run every time the view is referenced in a query.
trans-unit.target: CREATE VIEW 定义查询的视图。该视图未在实体上实现。而是，每次在查询中引用视图时都运行查询。

trans-unit.source: CROSS JOIN and INNER JOIN produce a simple Cartesian product, the same result as you get from listing the two tables at the top level of FROM, but restricted by the join condition (if any). CROSS JOIN is equivalent to INNER JOIN ON (TRUE), that is, no rows are removed by qualification. These join types are just a notational convenience, since they do nothing you couldn't do with plain FROM and WHERE.
trans-unit.target: CROSS JOIN 和 INNER JOIN 产生一个简单的笛卡尔乘积，与从 FROM 的顶层列出两个表所获得的结果相同，但受联接条件（如果有）的限制。 CROSS JOIN 等效于 INNER JOIN ON (TRUE) ，即，没有行被限定删除。这些 FROM 类型只是一种符号上的方便，因为它们无法执行普通FROM和 WHERE 无法完成的工作。

trans-unit.source: CURRENT_TIME and CURRENT_TIMESTAMP deliver values with time zone; LOCALTIME and LOCALTIMESTAMP deliver values without time zone.
trans-unit.target: CURRENT_TIME 和 CURRENT_TIMESTAMP 提供时区值； LOCALTIME 和 LOCALTIMESTAMP 传递没有时区的值。

trans-unit.source: CURRENT_TIME, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, LOCALTIME, and LOCALTIMESTAMP can optionally take a precision parameter, which causes the result to be rounded to that many fractional digits in the seconds field. Without a precision parameter, the result is given to the full available precision.
trans-unit.target: CURRENT_TIME ， CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ， LOCALTIME 和 LOCALTIMESTAMP 可以选择采用精度参数，该精度参数会导致将结果四舍五入到秒字段中的小数位数。如果没有精度参数，则将结果赋予全部可用精度。

trans-unit.source: Client: The server process is waiting for some activity on a socket from user applications, and that the server expects something to happen that is independent from its internal processes. wait_event will identify the specific wait point.
trans-unit.target: Client ：服务器进程正在等待来自用户应用程序的套接字上的某些活动，并且服务器希望发生独立于其内部进程的事件。 wait_event 将标识特定的等待点。

trans-unit.source: DEALLOCATE is used to deallocate a previously prepared SQL statement. If you do not explicitly deallocate a prepared statement, it is deallocated when the session ends.
trans-unit.target: DEALLOCATE 用于取消分配先前准备的SQL语句。如果未显式取消预分配的语句，则在会话结束时将其释放。

trans-unit.source: DECLARE allows a user to create cursors, which can be used to retrieve a small number of rows at a time out of a larger query. After the cursor is created, rows are fetched from it using FETCH.
trans-unit.target: DECLARE 允许用户创建游标，该游标可用于一次从较大查询中检索少量行。创建游标后，使用FETCH从游标中获取行。

trans-unit.source: DELETE deletes rows that satisfy the WHERE clause from the specified table. If the WHERE clause is absent, the effect is to delete all rows in the table. The result is a valid, but empty table.
trans-unit.target: DELETE 从指定的表中删除满足 WHERE 子句的行。如果 WHERE 子句不存在，则结果是删除表中的所有行。结果是一个有效但空的表。

trans-unit.source: DEPENDS ON EXTENSION extension_nameNO DEPENDS ON EXTENSION extension_name
DISCARD ALL cannot be executed inside a transaction block.
trans-unit.target: DISCARD ALL 不能在事务块内执行。

trans-unit.source: DISCARD releases internal resources associated with a database session. This command is useful for partially or fully resetting the session's state. There are several subcommands to release different types of resources; the DISCARD ALL variant subsumes all the others, and also resets additional state.
trans-unit.target: DISCARD 释放与数据库会话关联的内部资源。此命令对于部分或全部重置会话状态很有用。有几个子命令可以释放不同类型的资源。在 DISCARD ALL 变种涵括所有的人，也重置附加状态。

trans-unit.source: DISTINCT ON ( ... ) is an extension of the SQL standard.
DO executes an anonymous code block, or in other words a transient anonymous function in a procedural language.
trans-unit.target: DO 执行过程代码中的一个匿名代码块，或一个临时的匿名函数。

trans-unit.source: DROP ACCESS METHOD is a PostgreSQL extension.
DROP ACCESS METHOD removes an existing access method. Only superusers can drop access methods.
trans-unit.target: DROP ACCESS METHOD 删除现有的访问方法。只有超级用户可以删除访问方法。

trans-unit.source: DROP AGGREGATE removes an existing aggregate function. To execute this command the current user must be the owner of the aggregate function.
trans-unit.target: DROP AGGREGATE 删除现有的聚合函数。要执行此命令，当前用户必须是聚合函数的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP CAST removes a previously defined cast.
trans-unit.target: DROP CAST 删除以前定义的演员表。

trans-unit.source: DROP COLLATION removes a previously defined collation. To be able to drop a collation, you must own the collation.
trans-unit.target: DROP COLLATION 删除先前定义的排序规则。要删除排序规则，您必须拥有该排序规则。

trans-unit.source: DROP CONVERSION removes a previously defined conversion. To be able to drop a conversion, you must own the conversion.
trans-unit.target: DROP CONVERSION 删除以前定义的转换。为了放弃转换，您必须拥有该转换。

trans-unit.source: DROP DATABASE cannot be executed inside a transaction block.
trans-unit.target: DROP DATABASE 无法在事务块内部执行DROP DATABASE。

trans-unit.source: DROP DATABASE cannot be undone. Use it with care!
trans-unit.target: DROP DATABASE 无法撤消。小心使用！

trans-unit.source: DROP DATABASE drops a database. It removes the catalog entries for the database and deletes the directory containing the data. It can only be executed by the database owner. Also, it cannot be executed while you or anyone else are connected to the target database. (Connect to postgres or any other database to issue this command.)
trans-unit.target: DROP DATABASE 删除数据库。它删除数据库的目录条目，并删除包含数据的目录。它只能由数据库所有者执行。同样，当您或其他任何人连接到目标数据库时，也无法执行该命令。（连接到 postgres 或任何其他数据库以发出此命令。）

trans-unit.source: DROP DATABASE drops a database. It removes the catalog entries for the database and deletes the directory containing the data. It can only be executed by the database owner. It cannot be executed while you are connected to the target database. (Connect to postgres or any other database to issue this command.) Also, if anyone else is connected to the target database, this command will fail unless you use the FORCE option described below.
DROP DOMAIN removes a domain. Only the owner of a domain can remove it.
trans-unit.target: DROP DOMAIN 删除一个域。只有域的所有者才能将其删除。

trans-unit.source: DROP EVENT TRIGGER removes an existing event trigger. To execute this command, the current user must be the owner of the event trigger.
trans-unit.target: DROP EVENT TRIGGER 删除现有的事件触发器。要执行此命令，当前用户必须是事件触发器的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP EXTENSION removes extensions from the database. Dropping an extension causes its component objects to be dropped as well.
trans-unit.target: DROP EXTENSION 从数据库中删除扩展名。删除扩展会导致其组成对象也被删除。

trans-unit.source: DROP FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED). The IF EXISTS clause is a PostgreSQL extension.
trans-unit.target: DROP FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 符合ISO / IEC 9075-9（SQL / MED）。该 IF EXISTS 子句是PostgreSQL扩展。

trans-unit.source: DROP FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER removes an existing foreign-data wrapper. To execute this command, the current user must be the owner of the foreign-data wrapper.
trans-unit.target: DROP FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER 删除现有的外部数据包装器。要执行此命令，当前用户必须是外部数据包装器的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP FOREIGN TABLE removes a foreign table. Only the owner of a foreign table can remove it.
trans-unit.target: DROP FOREIGN TABLE 删除外部表。只有外部表的所有者才能将其删除。

trans-unit.source: DROP FUNCTION removes the definition of an existing function. To execute this command the user must be the owner of the function. The argument types to the function must be specified, since several different functions can exist with the same name and different argument lists.
trans-unit.target: DROP FUNCTION 删除现有功能的定义。要执行此命令，用户必须是该函数的所有者。必须指定函数的参数类型，因为可以存在多个具有相同名称和不同参数列表的不同函数。

trans-unit.source: DROP GROUP is now an alias for DROP ROLE.
trans-unit.target: DROP GROUP 现在是DROP ROLE的别名。

trans-unit.source: DROP INDEX drops an existing index from the database system. To execute this command you must be the owner of the index.
trans-unit.target: DROP INDEX 从数据库系统删除现有索引。要执行此命令，您必须是索引的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP INDEX is a PostgreSQL language extension. There are no provisions for indexes in the SQL standard.
trans-unit.target: DROP INDEX 是PostgreSQL语言扩展。SQL标准中没有索引的规定。

trans-unit.source: DROP LANGUAGE removes the definition of a previously registered procedural language. You must be a superuser or the owner of the language to use DROP LANGUAGE.
trans-unit.target: DROP LANGUAGE 删除先前注册的过程语言的定义。您必须是该语言的超级用户或所有者，才能使用 DROP LANGUAGE 。

trans-unit.source: DROP MATERIALIZED VIEW drops an existing materialized view. To execute this command you must be the owner of the materialized view.
trans-unit.target: DROP MATERIALIZED VIEW 删除现有的物化视图。要执行此命令，您必须是实例化视图的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP MATERIALIZED VIEW is a PostgreSQL extension.

DROP OPERATOR CLASS does not drop any of the operators or functions referenced by the class. If there are any indexes depending on the operator class, you will need to specify CASCADE for the drop to complete.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR CLASS 不会删除该类引用的任何运算符或函数。如果根据操作员类别有任何索引，则需要指定 CASCADE 才能完成放置。

trans-unit.source: DROP OPERATOR CLASS drops an existing operator class. To execute this command you must be the owner of the operator class.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR CLASS 删除现有的操作员类。要执行此命令，您必须是操作员类的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP OPERATOR CLASS will not drop the operator family containing the class, even if there is nothing else left in the family (in particular, in the case where the family was implicitly created by CREATE OPERATOR CLASS). An empty operator family is harmless, but for the sake of tidiness you might wish to remove the family with DROP OPERATOR FAMILY; or perhaps better, use DROP OPERATOR FAMILY in the first place.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR CLASS 即使家族中没有其他任何东西，DROP OPERATOR CLASS也不会删除包含该类的运营商系列（尤其是在该系列由 CREATE OPERATOR CLASS 隐式创建的情况下）。空的操作员家庭是无害的，但是出于整洁的考虑，您可能希望删除 DROP OPERATOR FAMILY 的家庭；也许更好，首先使用 DROP OPERATOR FAMILY 。

trans-unit.source: DROP OPERATOR FAMILY drops an existing operator family. To execute this command you must be the owner of the operator family.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR FAMILY 删除现有的操作员系列。要执行此命令，您必须是操作员系列的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP OPERATOR FAMILY includes dropping any operator classes contained in the family, but it does not drop any of the operators or functions referenced by the family. If there are any indexes depending on operator classes within the family, you will need to specify CASCADE for the drop to complete.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR FAMILY 包括删除该系列中包含的任何运算符类，但不会删除该系列引用的任何运算符或功能。如果根据族内的操作员类别有任何索引，则需要指定 CASCADE 才能完成放置。

trans-unit.source: DROP OPERATOR drops an existing operator from the database system. To execute this command you must be the owner of the operator.
trans-unit.target: DROP OPERATOR 从数据库系统中删除现有的运算符。要执行此命令，您必须是操作员的所有者。

trans-unit.source: DROP OWNED also takes care of removing any privileges granted to the target role for objects that do not belong to it. Because REASSIGN OWNED does not touch such objects, it's typically necessary to run both REASSIGN OWNED and DROP OWNED (in that order!) to fully remove the dependencies of a role to be dropped.
trans-unit.target: DROP OWNED 还负责删除授予不属于目标角色的对象的任何特权。由于 REASSIGN OWNED 不会触摸此类对象，因此通常必须同时运行 REASSIGN OWNED 和 DROP OWNED （以该顺序！）以完全删除要删除的角色的依赖关系。
